intro: Cacalia teres, commonly known as the dwarf thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Cacalia teres prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and borders.
